title: World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument: Historic Photos
body: Historic Photos                    USS Nevada (BB-36)    27 Photos  The USS Nevada (BB-36) was a US Navy battleship stationed at Pearl Harbor on Dec 7, 1941. Her sister ship was the USS Oklahoma. The Nevada suffered a minimum of six bomb hits and one torpedo hit during the attack. Fifty seven crewmembers died, and over 100 more were wounded.           USS Arizona (BB-39)   14 Photos  The USS Arizona (BB-39) was a US Navy battleship stationed at Pearl Harbor on Dec 7, 1941. Built in the 1910s, she was commissioned in 1916 and later transferred to the Pacific Fleet. The USS Arizona was bombed in the first few minutes of the Pearl Harbor attack. She exploded and sank, killing 1,177 officers and crewmen.          The USS Arizona Memorial - 1961 to 1984   25 Photos  The USS Arizona Memorial was built in 1962, just above (but not touching) the ruins of the USS Arizona.             Artifacts   16 Photos  Images of artifacts in the Monument's museum collection.          Attack on Pearl Harbor   1 Photos  These photos show the devastation caused by the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor on December 7, 1941.
